subject: Career
title: Why People Change Careers
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Why People Change Careers.

hook.text: The average person changes careers â€” not jobs, careers â€” three to seven times in their lifetime.

buildup.text: Technology, burnout, curiosity, and life events push people to reinvent professionally.

discovery.text: A Bureau of Labor Statistics study found workers hold an average of 12.4 jobs before age 55.

twist.text: Yet society still expects a linear path: study one thing, do it forever. The data says otherwise.

climax.text: Career changes aren't failures. They're adaptations to a world that never stops shifting.

punchline.text: The straight career path is the exception, not the rule.

quiz.question: How many times does the average person change careers in a lifetime?
